about.bio0: A Bioinformatics student and full-stack developer, I enjoy creating web solutions.
about.bio1: I'm a graduate student at Imperial College London, studying Bioinformatics. I've been involved in tech project management, digital marketing and entrepreneurship in several ventures. I am a self taught full-stack Web and App Developer and my passion is creating web applications that are both efficient and beautiful.
about.bio2: I am an MSc student in Bioinformatics and Theoretical Systems Biology at Imperial College London, with a Bachelor’s in Bioinformatics and Computer Science from the University of Calgary. Combining technical expertise with a passion for entrepreneurship, I co-founded LAN Digital, a digital marketing agency helping businesses worldwide enhance their online presence, and launched Obuci.rs, a pioneering second-hand clothing platform for the Balkan market. Currently, I am building NomadPlanner, a platform empowering digital nomads with tools for planning, budgeting, and connecting. Since starting web development in 2020, I’ve become proficient in full-stack development and honed leadership skills through diverse projects. My bioinformatics work includes applying machine learning to study cellular senescence at the Arnie Charbonneau Cancer Institute.
about.bio3: I’m currently pursuing an MSc in Bioinformatics and Theoretical Systems Biology at Imperial College London. Originally from Serbia, I hold a Bachelor’s degree in Bioinformatics and Computer Science from the University of Calgary, where I gained a solid foundation in computational biology and software development.
about.bio3-2: Over the years, I have been deeply involved in entrepreneurial ventures as part of extracurricular clubs and personal projects, blending my technical expertise with a passion for innovation and building cool stuff. I co-founded LAN Digital, a digital marketing agency dedicated to helping businesses worldwide elevate their online presence through tailored web solutions. In addition, I helped launch Obuci.rs, a second-hand clothing platform for the Balkan market, the likes of which has not yet existed in the region. Currently, I am building NomadPlanner, a digital platform designed to empower digital nomads by providing tools and relevant information for journey planning, budgeting, travel itineraries, and connecting with each other.
about.bio3-3: My journey in web development began in 2020, and since then, I have become proficient in full-stack development, working on diverse projects ranging from client-focused solutions to personal initiatives. My work and volunteering experience has honed my leadership and collaboration skills, enabling me to manage teams effectively and deliver award-winning projects. In the bioinformatics domain, I recently completed a project at the Arnie Charbonneau Cancer Institute, where I applied advanced statistical tools and machine learning pipelines to study cellular senescence. Beyond my professional pursuits, my hobbies and passions include tennis, travel, personal fitness, and motorsport.
about.numbers-desc: In the last year I have contributed

cv.intro: Highly motivated Full-Stack Engineer with 4+ years of experience crafting performant, accessible web applications using React, TypeScript, and Next.js. Currently pursuing an MSc in Bioinformatics, blending strong software development skills with a growing expertise in life sciences data and machine learning algorithms. Proven ability to lead and build projects from the ground up, mentor peers, and thrive in collaborative, fast-paced startup environments. Passionate about leveraging technology to solve complex problems and seeking a challenging role where I can contribute and take ownership of impactful projects and continue learning.
cv.intro-binf: Highly motivated MSc Bioinformatics student with extensive experience applying computational techniques and machine learning algorithms within research settings. Proficient with core bioinformatics tools and methodologies (e.g., sequence analysis, genomic data processing, statistical analysis using Python/R and relevant libraries like Biopython, Pandas, scikit-learn). My background also includes 4+ years of full-stack software development (React, TypeScript), providing a unique ability to not only perform complex analyses but also architect and build robust data pipelines, custom analysis tools, and interactive visualizations from the ground up. Proven ability to thrive in collaborative, fast-paced research environments. Passionate about leveraging computational power to solve challenging problems in life sciences and eager to contribute to impactful projects while continuously learning and evolving my skills.
cv.high-school: XIII Belgrade High School - Natural Sciences
cv.codedin: This CV was coded in ReactJS.
cv.exp1-1: Played a pivotal role in a dynamic team developing 'Where To?', a complex web application tackling event discovery and group planning.
cv.exp1-binf-1: Initiated and lead the development of a novel senescence-activated promoter reporter construct as part of my honours project.
cv.exp1-2: Assumed leadership of the front-end development effort, driving key architectural decisions and UI/UX strategy implementation.
cv.exp1-binf-2: Employed advanced analytical bioinformatics tools to identify and compare transcription factor binding sites, contributing to the design of a perfected senescence-associated promoter construct.
cv.exp1-binf-3: Conducted comprehensive wet lab procedures, including cell culture, transfection with lentiviral vectors, Western blotting, and fluorescence microscopy.
cv.exp1-binf-4: Collaborated effectively in a multidisciplinary research environment, combining expertise in bioinformatics and molecular biology to advance understanding of cellular senescence mechanisms.
cv.exp1-binf-skills: RNAseq, Cloning, Lentiviral Transfection, Western Blot, Fluorescence Microscopy, PCR, ChIP-qPCR, Gibson Assembly
cv.exp1-3: Developed core features using React, Next.js, Node.js, and TypeScript.
cv.exp1-4: Actively presented and pitched the 'Where To?' application to industry representatives (Microsoft, Unity, Arcurve), contributing to the project receiving the 'Best Design Award'.
cv.exp1-skills: ReactJS, Node, TypeScript, NextJS, ChakraUI, MongoDB
cv.exp2-1: Co-founded a digital marketing agency, taking a primary role in technology strategy and client engagement.
cv.exp2-2: Spearheaded UI design and front-end development using React, Next.js, and TypeScript to create visually appealing and user-friendly digital experiences.
cv.exp2-3: Architected, developed, and launched the agency's main website and numerous client websites, ensuring high performance and scalability.
cv.exp2-4: Managed client communications throughout project lifecycles, ensuring alignment and satisfaction.
cv.exp2-skills: JavaScript, TypeScript, ReactJS, NextJS, Node, SQL, Docker, TailwindCSS
cv.exp3-1: Working in a fast-paced startup environment, took ownership of critical data operations including detailed annotation of marketing assets for various well-known companies, ensuring high quality and accuracy.
cv.exp3-2: Demonstrated technical versatility by directly contributing to front-end development tasks using TypeScript and React to support application improvements alongside core operational duties.
cv.exp3-3: Actively participated in enhancing data processing efficiency by contributing to the testing and refinement of the internal Machine Learning pipeline designed to automate asset annotation.
cv.exp3-skills: TypeScript, React, Node, TensorFlow, AWS, Microsoft Excel
cv.exp4-1: Defined the product vision and strategy for 'EasyMeal,' an innovative mobile app combining meal planning, recipe curation, and gamification elements to engage users, leading the project to win the 'Best Overall Project Award'.
cv.exp4-2: Managed the end-to-end agile (SCRUM) development lifecycle, facilitating sprint planning, reviews, and retrospectives to ensure timely delivery of a user-centric mobile application.
cv.exp4-3: Actively contributed hands-on to front-end development using React Native and Firebase, implementing key user-facing features and bridging product concepts with technical execution.
cv.exp4-4: Mentored team members on mobile development best practices (React Native, Firebase) and agile methodologies, fostering collaboration and ensuring alignment with product goals.
cv.exp4-skills: TypeScript, React Native, Firebase, Agile (SCRUM), Product Management

projects.desc: Projects I have worked on as part of competitions and pitches as well as passion projects.
projects.p1: Looking to make cooking fun, discover new recipes and save money? Meet EasyMeal, the Duolingo of home cooking.
projects.p1-2: From the start, the premise of EasyMeal has been to utlilize advanced recipe curation and gamification to make cooking easy, fun and budget-friendly. This app helps users track macros, achieve daily cooking goals, level up, unlock badges, discover new recipes and get recommendations based on budget. We built EasyMeal using React Native (Expo) and Firebase.
projects.p2: Have you ever been tired of the amount of time it sometimes takes you and your group of friends to plan where to go on a friday evening?
projects.p2-2: Where To? is designed to streamline the planning process, simplifying decision-making for groups. The app intuitively suggests destinations based on the collective preferences of the group. Members can then cast their votes for their preferred choice, with the most popular option being selected automatically. Developed using NextJS, ChakraUI, and MongoDB, the app integrates the Google Places API to offer a wide range of location suggestions.
projects.p3: AutoBerza is the first dedicated online car auctioning market in the Balkans.
projects.p3-2: This passion project, currently in its early stages of development, aims to replicate the success of CarsAndBids, specifically for the Balkan region. The platform offers an intuitive and user-friendly online car auctioning market, a first of its kind in the Balkans. With this platform, users can seamlessly list their vehicles for auction or place bids on a wide selection of cars.
projects.mp-1: Sleek website for the Flex Team betting organization.
projects.mp-2: Your all in one cooking curation app!
projects.mp-3: The classic. Battleship game built using React Native.

portfolio.desc: Here you'll find lots of my info on my startups, work for clients and other serious projects I've worked on. Many have links so I encourage you to check them out and have a go.
portfolio.p1-desc: The first dedicated online second-hand clothing marketplace in the Balkans.
portfolio.p2-desc: A digital marketing agency I have founded with two of my best friends in 2021.
portfolio.p3-desc: Sleek and perfomant promotional website for the Flex Team betting organization.
portfolio.p4-desc: Flagship cross-platform app being developed for Obuci.rs
portfolio.p5-desc: CMS club website created for the Porsche Club in Serbia.

project1.desc: The first dedicated online second-hand clothing marketplace in the Balkans.
project1.desc1: Obuci.rs stands as a testament to minimalist, sleek, and modern design principles. My focus was to create a user interface that is not only visually appealing but also exceptionally intuitive and user-friendly. Prioritizing readability and ease of navigation, I wanted the website to be significantly more refined and accessible than comparable platforms in Serbia. The design process involved extensive wireframing and detailed design work in Figma. By leveraging TailwindCSS, I was able to bring this design to life, offering users a seamless and engaging online shopping experience.
project1.desc2: Obuci.rs stands out with its user-centric features. It streamlines the process of listing and purchasing second-hand clothing, coupled with an advanced chat feature for seamless seller-buyer communication. The platform ensures a smooth shopping experience with order tracking, timely notifications, and efficient advanced filtering. Additionally, users can enjoy a personalized experience through extensive profile customization options. These features, among many others, make Obuci.rs a versatile and user-centric marketplace.
project1.desc3: Choosing NextJS and Firebase for Obuci.rs's tech stack brought numerous performance benefits and functional advantages. NextJS's server-side rendering capabilities significantly enhanced the site's load times and SEO, crucial for an online marketplace's visibility and user engagement. Meanwhile, Firebase provided a robust backend solution, offering secure authentication, real-time database updates, and scalable hosting. This combination ensured a smooth, responsive user experience and ease of maintenance and updates

project2.desc: A digital marketing agency I have founded with two of my best friends in 2021.
project2.desc1: The design of my digital marketing agency website was intentionally crafted to embody simplicity, sleekness, and a modern aesthetic. Every element was chosen to create a clean and uncluttered interface, reflecting the agency’s forward-thinking and professional approach. The color palette, typography, and layout were all selected to ensure the site conveys a sense of sophistication and contemporary style, making it not only visually appealing but also easy and enjoyable to navigate for our clients.
project2.desc2: The primary focus was on accessibility and clarity of information. We prioritized making it exceptionally easy for clients to contact us, ensuring that all communication channels are prominently displayed and user-friendly. Simultaneously, we structured the website to present all necessary information in a concise, well-organized manner, allowing visitors to quickly grasp our services and values without being overwhelmed by excessive details.

project3.desc: Sleek and perfomant promotional website for the Flex Team betting organization.
project3.desc1: When developing this website, my vision was to create a design that truly captivates and holds attention. I achieved this by incorporating a series of flashy, dynamic elements - from eye-catching animations to glowing UI components. These design choices not give the website a premium feel but also ensure it distinctly stands out from those of other organizations. Every aspect of the site, from the color scheme to interactive features, is crafted to make a bold statement and engage visitors the moment they land on the page.
project3.desc2: A central theme in the design is transparency. Recognizing the importance of trust in the betting advisory sector, I incorporated a prominently displayed, real-time updated profit table on their website. This table transparently shows the winnings and losses for each betting tip by month, allowing users to independently verify the results. This feature not only emphasizes Flex Team's dedication to transparency but also significantly enhances their credibility and reputation for honesty in the eyes of their customers.
project3.desc3: A major accomplishment in this project was significantly reducing load times and optimizing various performance metrics. By implementing efficient coding practices, compressing assets, and utilizing static and server-side rendering, I ensured that the website not only runs smoothly but also provides a swift, seamless experience for all users.

project4.desc: Flagship cross-platform app being developed for Obuci.rs.
project4.desc1: For the Obuci.rs app, choosing the right tech stack was crucial, with many options on the table. We opted for a cross-platform approach and ultimately selected Expo for React Native, drawing on our strong background in React. This choice allowed for a smooth, unified development experience. For the backend, we aligned with the website's setup by continuing with Firebase, ensuring consistency and efficiency across both web and mobile platforms.
project4.desc2: Our goal was to elevate the user experience beyond what the website offered, focusing on creating a smoother, more intuitive interface. We envisioned the app as the primary access point for Obuci.rs going forward, optimizing it for ease of use and seamless navigation. By enhancing the app's functionality and user experience, we aimed to encourage users to prefer the app for their interactions with Obuci.rs.
project4.desc3: Working on the Obuci.rs app is a journey of continuous learning for me. As someone relatively new to app development, using React Native is both challenging and rewarding. This project is not just about improving the platform; it's a valuable chance for me to grow my skills in a practical setting. While the app is still evolving, each step in its development is teaching me more about building user-focused, efficient applications.

project5.desc: CMS club website created for the Porsche Club in Serbia.
project5.desc1: Working on the Porsche Club Serbia website, my first website project, was a real learning experience. Hosted on Porsche's official CMS, I faced the challenge of its limited flexibility, as it offered minimal room for customization. Despite these constraints, I did my best to work within the CMS's framework, striving to create a visually appealing and functional site. This project taught me a lot about adapting to less-than-ideal circumstances and making the most of the tools at hand.
project5.desc2: Within the constraints of the CMS for the Porsche Club Serbia website, I found a silver lining in the chance to learn about SEO. The limitations in customization shifted my focus towards optimizing the site's search engine performance. It was a hands-on learning experience, where I gained practical knowledge in SEO, helping to improve the site's online visibility. This project was a valuable lesson in making the most of available opportunities and enhancing my understanding of essential web optimization techniques.

siteinfo.p1: This site is my corner of the internet. I use it to showcase projects I have worked on and document my web development journey.
siteinfo.p2: The site has been redesigned and rebuilt many times. Its current tech stack uses NextJS and Tailwindcss. All UX design and code was completed by me with a little inspiration.

uses.h1: Software I use, and other things I recommend.
uses.vscode: Visual Studio Code is a free source-code editor made by Microsoft for Windows, Linux and macOS.
uses.firefox: I use firefox because of its superb web development features compared to other browsers.
uses.dribble: Arguably the home of designers online.
uses.pages: A hall of fame for simply beautiful websites.
uses.uplabs: A great place for designs along with their original files for download. Most of them are free.
uses.next: A React based static site generator powered by GraphQL.
uses.tailwind: A utility-first CSS framework for rapidly building custom designs.
uses.vercel: A cloud platform for static sites and Serverless Functions.

themes.replace: Replace it with one of these:
